EXECUTIVE DIRECTOR’S LETTER NO* 8
February Us 1952
THE MIDWEST LOOKS GOOD—With more than 3*000 miles oa ay car since 1 last saw
Urbana I pulled in hero Wednesday morning to find the desk thoroughly covered.
Three solid days of work have let me get down to at least a minimum oi working
space. Needless to say two weeks is plenty to spend amy from heme.
My visit with Kendall Crane at Duquocxie University oonvinoed me Nhat
here ms one area which we thought virtually dead but it actually is really full
of life. Crane is a driver? ho has plenty of support from his administration and
has finally convinced the newspapers tiiat they should carry the YcDUQ program
schedule, lie is making himself hoard in Pittsburgh. This is one area we can
count on in the future*
LEHIGII UNIVERSITY, BETHLEHEM, PA.—I had ay first opportunity to visit an associate
member. Barrett Davis, the direotor, is doing a fine job with what he has. He
has many of our problems plus many added tasks which surround a relatively small
independent male college* He spoke very highly of HAEB and made two very fine
suggestions—one, that there be an "ASSOCIATEfL PAGE” in each issue of the News-
Letter and, two, that additional copies of the News-Letter should be available to
those members who wish to buy them at, say at a year. At last count, we
had Ul associate members. Undoubtedly, they should be considered more in our
operational plan.
I will not comment on the New York meetings. You were all there and have
your own ideas.
Prior to the meetings I had a chance to visit Dorothy Lewis, U. IU Radio,
who gave plenty of promises of cooperation, following the meetings, I had a
chance to do the New York work on seeing that our UNESCO exhibit got properly set up.
five days in Washington were put to good use. I was luohy and found
Lowdoroilk, Broderick, and Dunham all in at the USOE Radio Office* If you haven’t
kept up with things these people are doing, it would be worthwhile to investigate.
Also visited with John Mieghor (pronounced Harr) of the Department of State Radio-
TV Lais ion. lie is limning the ball for us on the new Voice of American radio
series. lie is also trying to secure permission for us to utilise in some manner
the tremendous backlog program material available at the Voice of America Library
in New York.
I had the opportunity to have a very fine dinner with Ralph Stootle and
his fine family and to hear more about the JCLT work* Also with xVonk Abbott of
the American Council, with further details on the forthcoming Pennsylvania meeting.
